Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that Joe Biden and Gretchen Whitmer were ignoring face-covering rules in Detroit, when in fact the photos were taken before the COVID-19 pandemic and the event was a private fundraising event with limited attendees.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that Biden and Whitmer were ignoring face-covering rules. The photos were taken out of context and do not reflect the current guidelines or actions of the individuals involved.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photos are recent and that Biden and Whitmer were not following public health guidance, without considering alternative explanations or the context in which the photos were taken.
Exist alternative explanation: The photos were taken before the COVID-19 pandemic and were from a private fundraising event with limited attendees. The individuals involved may have followed the guidelines in place at that time, which did not require masks for everyone.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the photos were taken before the COVID-19 pandemic and do not reflect the current guidelines or actions of Biden and Whitmer.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in the provided claim.
